intro: Neolloydia gautii, commonly known as the Gautt's lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Neolloydia gautii is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its beauty. It is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
